attribute.name: silent_install
attribute.description: If true, run the install silently (without requiring user input)

element.name: configuration (type='install')
element.description: A configuration used to install a collection of components.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: 'install' - Type of the configuration. Can be 'install' or 'reference'.

attribute.name: lcid
attribute.description: A filter to install this configuration only on all operating system language equals or not equals than the LCID specified (see Help->LCID Table). Separate multiple LCID with comma (',') and use not symbol ('!') for NOT logic (es. '1044,1033,!1038' ). You can also filter a specified component.

attribute.name: dialog_caption
attribute.description: Main dialog title.

attribute.name: dialog_message
attribute.description: Main message of the main dialog.

attribute.name: dialog_bitmap
attribute.description: Bitmap file used in the left panel of the main dialog. If this file doesn't exist or this attribute is empty the application load the bitmap from the .exe resource. Can contains path constant (see Help->Path Constant).

attribute.name: skip_caption
attribute.description: Caption of the Skip button.

attribute.name: install_caption
attribute.description: Caption of the Install button.

attribute.name: cancel_caption
attribute.description: Caption of the Cancel button.

attribute.name: reinstallflag_caption
attribute.description: Caption for the 'Reinstall all check box'.

attribute.name: status_installed
attribute.description: The string used for indicating an installed component.

attribute.name: status_notinstalled
attribute.description: The string used for indicating a not installed component.

attribute.name: failed_exec_command_continue
attribute.description: The message used when a component cannot be installed and ask if the application can continue with others components (Yes/No message). Must contain one '%s' string where the application put the description of the component.

attribute.name: installation_completed
attribute.description: Installation completed message.

attribute.name: installing_component_wait
attribute.description: The message used when installing a component. Must contain one '%s' string where the application put the description of the component.

attribute.name: reboot_required
attribute.description: The message used when the application need to restart and ask if restart now (with a Yes/No message).

attribute.name: advanced_caption
attribute.description: Caption of the Advanced button. Used to show the 'Component Selector' dialog with the complete list of components available to install. If empty the button Advanced is not available.

attribute.name: dialog_selector_caption
attribute.description: Component Selector dialog title, this dialog shows the complete list of components available to install.

attribute.name: dialog_selector_message
attribute.description: Component Selector dialog description, this dialog shows the complete list of components available to install.

attribute.name: dialog_selector_cancel
attribute.description: Component Selector dialog Cancel caption button.

attribute.name: dialog_otherinfo_caption
attribute.description: Caption of the link at the bottom of the main dialog that open the link specified in the dialog_otherinfo_link attribute. If empty the link is hidden. Usually used for help, readme or internet link. See also dialog_otherinfo_link attribute.

attribute.name: dialog_otherinfo_link
attribute.description: Command to execute when the user click on the link at the bottom of the main installation dialog. Can be any valid command (executable, document, web page, ...) valid for the ShellExecute API. Must be defined the dialog_otherinfo_caption attribute. Can contains path constant (see Help->Path Constant).

attribute.name: complete_command
attribute.description: Command executed when all components are installed correctly; can be any executable, document or web page valid for ShellExecute API. Usually is a readme file, a web page or a startup file. If empty no command is executed.

attribute.name: auto_close_if_installed
attribute.description: If true auto close the dialog if all the components are already installed (before closing dotNetInstaller always execute the complete message box and execute the complete command).

attribute.name: os_filter_greater
attribute.description: Filter for minimum operating system version

attribute.name: os_filter_smaller
attribute.description: Filter for maximum operating system version

attribute.name: os_filter_not_match_message
attribute.description: Message if the current operating system does not match the operating system filter

element.name: configuration (type='reference')
element.description: A configuration used to download a configuration file from a specific URL.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: 'reference' - Type of the configuration. Can be 'install' or 'reference'.

attribute.name: lcid
attribute.description: A filter to install this configuration only on all operating system language equals or not equals than the LCID specified (see Help->LCID Table). Separate multiple LCID with comma (',') and use not symbol ('!') for NOT logic (es. '1044,1033,!1038' ). You can also filter a specified component. If empty no filter is applied.

element.name: configfile
element.description: The path to the configuration file downloaded.

attribute.name: filename
attribute.description: The configuration file where the application can find the configuration. Usually this is the destination directory of the downloaded component. Can contains path constant (see Help->Path Constant).

element.name: components
element.description: A collection of elements of type 'component'.

element.name: component (see also specific help based on the 'type' attribute)

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the component; can be 'cmd' for executing generic command line installation or 'msi' for installing Windows Installer MSI package or 'openfile' to open a file. Each type has his own attributes.

attribute.name: os_filter_greater
attribute.description: A filter to install this component only on all operating system id greater than the id specified (see Help->Operating System Table). For example to install a component only in Windows 2000 or later write '44'.

attribute.name: os_filter_smaller
attribute.description: A filter to install this component only on all operating system id smaller than the id specified (see operating system table). For example to install a component preceding Windows 2000 write '45'.

attribute.name: os_filter_lcid
attribute.description: A filter to install this component only on all operating system language equals or not equals than the LCID specified (see Help->LCID table). Separate multiple LCID with comma (',') and use not symbol ('!') for NOT logic (es. '1044,1033,!1038' ). You can also filter all the configuration element.

attribute.name: installcompletemessage
attribute.description: The message used when a component is successfully installed. To disable this message leave this property empty.

attribute.name: mustreboot
attribute.description: Indicates if ask to reboot after this component is installed successfully (True/False). Normally if the system must be restarted is automatically the component that tells this setup (with special return code) to stop and restart the system, but in special circumstances (for example in Windows 98) we must force a reboot to install correctly some components (for example the .NET Framework).

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of this component. This value is used also in some message to replace the %s string.

attribute.name: note
attribute.description: Note, not used by the setup.

element.name: component (type='cmd')
element.description: A component that can be used to execute an .exe file like a setup application.

attribute.description: see also 'component' element

attribute.name: command
attribute.description: Specifies the command to execute when installing this component. Must be a valid command for the 'CreateProcess' API. Can contain " char and path constant (see Help->Path Constant).

element.name: component (type='msi')
element.description: A component that can be used to install an msi package.

attribute.description: see also 'component' element

attribute.name: package
attribute.description: Specifies the path to the msi package to execute when installing this component. Can contain path constant (see Help->Path Constant).

attribute.name: cmdparameters
attribute.description: Specifies the command line parameters for the msiexec program. Can contain " char and path constant (see Help->Path Constant). See MSDN for the command line you can use with Windows Installer.

element.name: component (type='openfile')
element.description: A component that can be used to open a web page, a readme file or execute any file during the installation process.

attribute.description: see also 'component' element

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: Specifies the file to open when installing this component. Must be a valid command for the 'ShellExecute' API. Can contain " char and path constant (see Help->Path Constant). Can be for example a internet link.

element.name: downloaddialog
element.description: Represents a list of files to download and the configurations of the download dialog.

attribute.name: dialog_caption
attribute.description: The caption of the download dialog.

attribute.name: dialog_message
attribute.description: The initial message that appears in the download dialog before the user press the 'Start' button.

attribute.name: autostartdownload
attribute.description: True to start the download without user interaction, False to let the user press the 'Start' button.

attribute.name: dialog_message_downloading
attribute.description: The message that appears in the download dialog when the download process start.

attribute.name: buttonstart_caption
attribute.description: Caption of the 'Start' button.

attribute.name: buttoncancel_caption
attribute.description: Caption of the 'Cancel' button.

element.name: downloads
element.description: A collection of elements of type 'download'.

element.name: download
element.description: Represent a single file to download.

attribute.name: componentname
attribute.description: The description of the file to download.

attribute.name: sourceurl
attribute.description: The complete source path of the file to download. For example 'http://www.yourwebsite.com/SetupX/Setup.exe' . Must be URL with http:// or ftp:// protocol

attribute.name: destinationpath
attribute.description: The complete destination path where the application copy the sourceurl file. Is recommended to use the TEMP path for destination like this: '#TEMPPATH\\APPLICATION_NAME' . Can contains path constant (see Help->Path Constant).

attribute.name: destinationfilename
attribute.description: New name of the downloaded file. Leave this value empty to use the same filename of the original filename.

attribute.name: alwaysdownload
attribute.description: If true, always download the file; if false, do not download if the file already exists in the destination path

element.name: installedcheck (type='check_file')
element.description: The application check if a component is installed looking for the specified registry information or file.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: 'check_file' - Type of the check, can be 'check_registry_value' to check for a specific value in the registry or 'check_file' to check for a specific file.

attribute.name: filename
attribute.description: Specifies the file to search, if the application cannot find the specified file then the component must be installed. This attribute can contain path constant (see Help->Path Constant).

attribute.name: fileversion
attribute.description: The version of the file, can be used to perform version check based on comparison attribute. If empty the application check only for the presence of the file.

attribute.name: comparison
attribute.description: Comparison mode, can be 'match' to check if the exact version of the file is present or 'version' to compare if a version equal or greater is present.

element.name: installedcheck (type='check_registry_value')
element.description: The application check if a component is installed looking for the specified registry information or file.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: 'check_registry_value' - Type of the check, can be 'check_registry_value' to check for a specific value in the registry or 'check_file' to check for a specific file.

attribute.name: rootkey
attribute.description: The root key for the path property.

attribute.name: path
attribute.description: Specifies the registry path to search for the registry value specified, the root of this path must be specified in the rootkey property. Example for this property: 'SOFTWARE\\MyCompany'

attribute.name: fieldname
attribute.description: The registry field name in the specified path, for example 'Installed'.

attribute.name: fieldvalue
attribute.description: The registry value used to check if the component is installed, this value is converted based on the 'fieldtype' specified.

attribute.name: fieldtype
attribute.description: Specifies the type of the registry field, can be 'REG_DWORD' (for numeric value), 'REG_SZ' (for string value) or 'REG_MULTI_SZ' (for multiline string value).

attribute.name: comparison
attribute.description: Comparison mode; can be 'exists' to check if a registy field for an registry key exists; for fieldtype 'REG_SZ' or 'REG_MULTI_SZ' it can be 'contains' to check if the string value contain the string specified with 'fieldvalue'; 'match' to check if the exact value is present in the registry or 'version' to compare the registry version with the specified version and return true if the registry version is equal or greater then the version specified.
